content.raw:
Hi, I’m kuwano.  
I’m trying to run gazebo\_scene\_viewer on ubuntu 18.04.

I’ve done the ignition-rendering installation\(Source install\) following README.md.  
[#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/src/default/README.md#markdown-header-building-from-source](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/src/default/README.md#markdown-header-building-from-source)

Although gazebo\_scene\_viewer can connect to gzserver, the following error occurs and cannot be executed.  
Why this error occured ?

```
kuwano@kuwano-pc:~/ign-rendering/examples/gazebo_scene_viewer/build$ ./gazebo_scene_viewer
[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 192.168.0.14
Engine 'ogre' is not supported
Engine 'optix' is not supported
Segmentation fault (コアダンプ)
```

# Environment

* ubuntu 18.04 LTS
* Intel® Core™ i7-6700K CPU @ 4.00GHz × 8
* GeForce GTX 1060 6GB/PCIe/SSE2
* RAM 32GB
* CUDA toolkit 10.0
* OptiX-SDK-6.5.0
* Gazebo-9

```
kuwano@kuwano-pc:~$ nvidia-smi
Fri Dec 6 16:35:50 2019
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| NVIDIA-SMI 440.33.01 Driver Version: 440.33.01 CUDA Version: 10.2 |
|-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
| GPU Name Persistence-M| Bus-Id Disp.A | Volatile Uncorr. ECC |
| Fan Temp Perf Pwr:Usage/Cap| Memory-Usage | GPU-Util Compute M. |
|===============================+======================+======================|
| 0 GeForce GTX 106... On | 00000000:01:00.0 On | N/A |
| 0% 49C P0 31W / 180W | 568MiB / 6075MiB | 4% Default |
+-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Processes: GPU Memory || GPU PID Type Process name Usage |
|=============================================================================|
| 0 1046 G /usr/lib/xorg/Xorg 18MiB |
| 0 1088 G /usr/bin/gnome-shell 48MiB |
| 0 2324 G /usr/lib/xorg/Xorg 205MiB |
| 0 2470 G /usr/bin/gnome-shell 95MiB |
| 0 9592 G ...quest-channel-token=6352663722780733213 110MiB |
| 0 22021 G gzserver 3MiB |
 0 22022 G gzclient 78MiB |
| 0 23057 G gnome-control-center 1MiB |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
kuwano@kuwano-pc:~$ nvcc -V
nvcc: NVIDIA (R) Cuda compiler driver
Copyright (c) 2005-2019 NVIDIA Corporation
Built on Wed_Oct_23_19:24:38_PDT_2019
Cuda compilation tools, release 10.2, V10.2.8
```

‌
content.html:
Hi, I’m kuwano.
I’m trying to run gazebo_scene_viewer on ubuntu 18.04.

I’ve done the ignition-rendering installation(Source install) following README.md.
#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/src/default/README.md#markdown-header-building-from-source

Although gazebo_scene_viewer can connect to gzserver, the following error occurs and cannot be executed.
Why this error occured ?

kuwano@kuwano-pc:~/ign-rendering/examples/gazebo_scene_viewer/build$ ./gazebo_scene_viewer
[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 192.168.0.14
Engine 'ogre' is not supported
Engine 'optix' is not supported
Segmentation fault (コアダンプ)

Environment

  • ubuntu 18.04 LTS
  • Intel® Core™ i7-6700K CPU @ 4.00GHz × 8
  • GeForce GTX 1060 6GB/PCIe/SSE2
  • RAM 32GB
  • CUDA toolkit 10.0
  • OptiX-SDK-6.5.0
  • Gazebo-9
kuwano@kuwano-pc:~$ nvidia-smi
Fri Dec 6 16:35:50 2019
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+

 0 22022 G gzclient 78MiB |
| 0 23057 G gnome-control-center 1MiB |
